questions.question: Identify the eye condition that someone with vision like that in Figure 1 is experiencing.
As a person ages, what ability of their eye tends to diminish the most?
options: Contracting ciliary muscles to decrease lens power
Contracting ciliary muscles to increase lens power
questions.answer: Contracting ciliary muscles to increase lens power

questions.question: What part of the eye has the highest optical power?

Dave’s eye ranges from an optical power of 47.0 to 52.0. For simplicity, you can model his eye as one lens focusing light onto the retina, which is 20 mm away from the lens. What is the closest object to his eye that he can see clearly?
The speed of light in a material is 2 × 10⁸ m/s. What is the material’s index of refraction?
A light ray strikes a mirror at an angle of 35° to the normal. What is the angle of reflection?
What type of lens is used in glasses to correct nearsightedness (myopia)?
Which of the following is corrected using cylindrical lenses in glasses?
What is Snell’s Law?
options: The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection.
The product of the refractive index and the sine of the angle of incidence is constant across the boundary between two media.
The refractive index is proportional to the wavelength of light passing through a medium.
Light bends only when passing from a denser medium to a less dense medium.
questions.answer: The product of the refractive index and the sine of the angle of incidence is constant across the boundary between two media.

questions.question: Jeffrey uses a magnifying glass to look at a bug. He places the magnifying glass 5 cm above the bug, and he sees that the bug looks upright and magnified 2x. What is the focal length of the magnifying glass?
The 'infrared window' is a window of wavelengths between 8 and 14 microns in the Earth's atmosphere that is crucial in regulating its temperatures and preventing warming. Why?
questions.answer: The atmosphere transmits a lot of this radiation outwards, allowing Earth to regulate temperature.

questions.question: A light ray enters a prism with an apex angle of 60° and a refractive index of 1.6. The angle of incidence is 40°. If the ray emerges symmetrically, calculate the angle of deviation.
Provide one example each of an everyday item that uses additive and subtractive color theory.
questions.answer: Additive: TV or computer screens; Subtractive: Color printers.

questions.question: Hypothetically, a shirt that appeared to be blue under white light had a red light shone upon it. What color would the shirt appear to be now, and why?
questions.answer: The shirt would appear black since it absorbs the red light and has no blue light to reflect.

questions.question: Describe the role of the aperture, lens, and sensor in a camera.
questions.answer: Aperture controls light amount, lens focuses light, sensor captures and converts it to an image.

questions.question: What type of telescope is a Schmidt–Cassegrain telescope? Why is it popular among amateur astronomers?
questions.answer: It is a catadioptric telescope, popular due to its compact design and high-quality images.

questions.question: Describe the design of a Ritchey–Chrétien telescope and why it is suitable for astrophotography.
questions.answer: Uses hyperbolic mirrors to eliminate coma and spherical aberration, providing sharp images over a wide field of view.
